name: Qvin
headline: Empowering women. Period.
description:
Qvin is the first and only healthcare service to scientifically prove menstrual blood can test for critical health information – just like a traditional laboratory blood test.

Women's health has always been under-prioritized in science. We still operate in a world built by men, for men. It’s why in 2014, Dr. Sara Naseri and Søren Therkelsen started Qvin to research, develop, and patent a product that powers an underserved and understudied population—women.

Over 70% of the decisions our doctors make are influenced by blood test results.  Every month, 1.8 billion people across the world menstruate. However, the blood our bodies naturally deliver every month has never been explored as a testing source. And yet, menstrual blood has been left unexplored.

Qvin is the first and only healthcare service to use period blood as a non-invasive blood test. We exist to give women an easy, insightful way to monitor existing health issues, proactively screen for others, and go into doctor visits more informed and confident of their own health.

Our health technology platform helps women manage their health better through a non-invasive blood collection device named the Q-Pad™.

All of us at Qvin want to move the study of women forward. We want to close the gender data gap. And we stand for every person who identifies with women, however they define it.

Menstrual blood isn’t waste
#  Your period is now an opportunity for better health.
Our vision is to empower you to harness the diagnostic power of your period as an alternative to traditional lab testing.
Turn your monthly menstrual blood into lab reports and access personalized health data, all from home. It’s finally time to have autonomy over our health.
  * Receive health insights from menstrual blood
  * Needle free, at home sample collection
  * Put your period to use

Q-PAD EMPOWERING WOMEN. PERIOD.TM
##  A pad with a purpose.
![Organic Cotton Q-Pad Collection Device](https://qvin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Artwork-1-1.svg)
The first and only FDA-cleared menstrual pad scientifically proven to collect blood for lab testing.
We believe all people who menstruate should have the choice to a non-invasive and needle-free way of managing their health. We’ve crafted the Q-Pad to be conveniently and seamlessly used during menstruation.
![The Qvin Q-Pad A1c Test, FDA Cleared & FSA / HSA Eligible](https://qvin.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Qvin-Amazon-FSAFDA-badges-03.jpg)
Order the A1c kit
##  Advocate for  yourself  and your health.
Pioneer the use of menstrual blood for health screening.
Use the A1c kit to obtain:
CLIA-Certified A1c lab reports
Health insights from menstrual blood
Free shipping
FSA / HSA Eligible
[ View Product Information ](https://qvin.com/</a1c-early-access-kit/>)
Error: GraphQL Client: Failed to fetch
A smartphone with internet access is recommended for optimal use of our service. Must be 18+ years to use.
Ending the Stigma
##  Health not hygiene.
Over 70% of health decisions are made from lab work.
Your period blood tells you about biomarkers that could impact your health.
### BIOMARKER AVAILABLE NOW
### HbA1C (Hemoglobin A1c)
Measures average blood sugar
Error: GraphQL Client: Failed to fetch
##### This test is cleared by the FDA for monitoring your blood sugar (glucose) control over time if you have diabetes. It's not for screening or diagnosing diabetes or checking daily glucose levels. Don't change your medications based only on these results. Don’t use it if you're pregnant, have serious blood loss, or certain blood conditions.
### BIOMARKERS IN DEVELOPMENT
### TSH (Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone)
Initial test for thyroid health.
### CRP (C-Reactive Protein)
Indicates levels of inflammation.
### AMH (Anti-Mullerian Hormone)
Indicates the status of ovarian reserve, for fertility and peri-menopause.
### FSH (Follicle-Stimulating Hormone)
Tests ovulation health, for fertility and peri-menopause.
### LH (Luteinising Hormone)
Indicates menstrual health, for fertility and peri-menopause.
### HR-HPV (High Risk Human Papillomavirus)
Leading cause of Cervical Cancer.
##### The Q-Pad test system is not FDA-cleared to test for these biomarkers.
harness your health
##  How it works. All from home.
Taking care of ourselves just got easier.
Use two Q-Pads during your monthly cycle. Mail both collection strips to the lab in pre-paid packaging and you will receive your A1c lab report in our app.
Use Q-Pad
![Group](https://qvin.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/Group.svg)
Mail collection strips to lab
![Q-Pad Collection Strip Return Shipping Container](https://qvin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/2.png)
Receive secure, digital lab reports in the app or via email
![A1c report example mobile app image](https://qvin.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/A1c-mobile-app-image.png)
Closing the Gender Data Gap
##  Women's health has always been under prioritized in science.
Exercise your right to participate in research.
Female biology has not been studied equally since the beginning of medical research. The data used to guide clinical diagnosis today is biased to male biology. So, when women are not included in research, medical diagnosis may not be accurate for women.
You have the right to participate in research and be represented.
[ LEARN MORE ](https://qvin.com/</research/>)
CLOSING THE GENDER DATA GAP
Women’s health has always been under prioritized in science.
We want to change this.
Female biology has not been studied equally since the beginning of medical research. The data used to guide clinical diagnosis today is biased to male biology. You have the choice to be represented in medical research to revolutionize women's health.
[ LEARN MORE ](https://qvin.com/</research/>)
Changing the conversation

Source: National HPV Study
about us
##  A team of  scientific rebels
We are a group of people who believe something that 1.8 billion women do at any given month should not go unanswered.
In 2014, Qvin™ was founded to research and develop a product that powers an underserved and understudied population — women.
We have been challenging the status quo on period blood as a health, not hygiene product.
Qvin [pronounced kwɪn] is derived from the word woman in Denmark. We stand for every person who identifies with women, however they define it.
![Abstract artistic interpretation of Menstrual blood and Venous Blood Regression Analysis](https://qvin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/scintific-rebels.svg)

Q-PAD EMPOWERING WOMEN. PERIOD.TM
##  A pad with a purpose.
![Organic Cotton Q-Pad Collection Device⟨14⟩]
The first and only FDA-cleared menstrual pad scientifically proven to collect blood for lab testing.
We believe all people who menstruate should have the choice to a non-invasive and needle-free way of managing their health. We’ve crafted the Q-Pad to be conveniently and seamlessly used during menstruation.
![The Qvin Q-Pad A1c Test, FDA Cleared & FSA / HSA Eligible⟨15⟩]
Order the A1c kit
##  Advocate for  yourself  and your health.
Pioneer the use of menstrual blood for health screening.
Use the A1c kit to obtain:
CLIA-Certified A1c lab reports
Health insights from menstrual blood
Free shipping
FSA / HSA Eligible
 View Product Information ⟨16⟩
Error: GraphQL Client: Failed to fetch
A smartphone with internet access is recommended for optimal use of our service. Must be 18+ years to use.
Ending the Stigma
##  Health not hygiene.
Over 70% of health decisions are made from lab work.
Your period blood tells you about biomarkers that could impact your health.
### BIOMARKER AVAILABLE NOW
### HbA1C (Hemoglobin A1c)
Measures average blood sugar
Error: GraphQL Client: Failed to fetch
##### This test is cleared by the FDA for monitoring your blood sugar (glucose) control over time if you have diabetes. It's not for screening or diagnosing diabetes or checking daily glucose levels. Don't change your medications based only on these results. Don’t use it if you're pregnant, have serious blood loss, or certain blood conditions.
### BIOMARKERS IN DEVELOPMENT
### TSH (Thyroid-Stimulating Hormone)
Initial test for thyroid health.
### CRP (C-Reactive Protein)
Indicates levels of inflammation.
### AMH (Anti-Mullerian Hormone)
Indicates the status of ovarian reserve, for fertility and peri-menopause.
### FSH (Follicle-Stimulating Hormone)
Tests ovulation health, for fertility and peri-menopause.
### LH (Luteinising Hormone)
Indicates menstrual health, for fertility and peri-menopause.
### HR-HPV (High Risk Human Papillomavirus)
Leading cause of Cervical Cancer.
##### The Q-Pad test system is not FDA-cleared to test for these biomarkers.
harness your health
##  How it works. All from home.
Taking care of ourselves just got easier.
Use two Q-Pads during your monthly cycle. Mail both collection strips to the lab in pre-paid packaging and you will receive your A1c lab report in our app.
Use Q-Pad
![Group⟨17⟩]
Mail collection strips to lab
![Q-Pad Collection Strip Return Shipping Container⟨18⟩]
Receive secure, digital lab reports in the app or via email
![A1c report example mobile app image⟨19⟩]
Closing the Gender Data Gap
##  Women's health has always been under prioritized in science.
Exercise your right to participate in research.
Female biology has not been studied equally since the beginning of medical research. The data used to guide clinical diagnosis today is biased to male biology. So, when women are not included in research, medical diagnosis may not be accurate for women.
You have the right to participate in research and be represented.
 LEARN MORE ⟨20⟩
CLOSING THE GENDER DATA GAP
Women’s health has always been under prioritized in science.
We want to change this.
Female biology has not been studied equally since the beginning of medical research. The data used to guide clinical diagnosis today is biased to male biology. You have the choice to be represented in medical research to revolutionize women's health.
 LEARN MORE ⟨20⟩
Changing the conversation

about us
##  A team of  scientific rebels
We are a group of people who believe something that 1.8 billion women do at any given month should not go unanswered.
In 2014, Qvin™ was founded to research and develop a product that powers an underserved and understudied population — women.
We have been challenging the status quo on period blood as a health, not hygiene product.
Qvin [pronounced kwɪn] is derived from the word woman in Denmark. We stand for every person who identifies with women, however they define it.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Qvin**

**Mission:** Empowering women. Period.

Founded in 2014 by Dr. Sara Naseri and Søren Therkelsen, Qvin is revolutionizing the healthcare landscape by focusing on women’s health—a field long undervalued in medical research. Operating out of Menlo Park, California, and part of Y Combinator's Batch W16, Qvin is tackling the gender data gap in health studies, aiming to give women the autonomy and insights they deserve about their health.

**Innovative Approach:**  
Qvin is the first healthcare service to scientifically validate that menstrual blood can provide critical health information through testing, much like traditional blood tests. With 1.8 billion individuals menstruating globally each month, this innovation offers a significant leap in how we understand and manage women’s health.

Their flagship product, the **Q-Pad™**, is designed as a non-invasive alternative to traditional blood collection methods. This FDA-cleared menstrual pad allows users to collect their menstrual blood comfortably and send it to a certified lab for analysis—turning what was once seen as waste into a valuable health resource. 

**Current Offerings:**  
Qvin has focused its early efforts on the **HbA1c test**, which measures average blood sugar levels, helping women monitor their health effectively from the comfort of their homes. The company has plans to expand its testing capabilities to include additional biomarkers relevant to women's health, such as thyroid function and fertility indicators.

**Team and Community:**  
With a team of 30 passionate individuals and Jared Friedman as their Group Partner, Qvin is more than a tech startup; it is a movement pushing for inclusive health innovation. They aim to create a community around female empowerment and health education, ensuring that all people who menstruate can advocate for their health with the right tools and knowledge.

**Conclusion:**  
Qvin is changing the narrative around women’s health, actively working to make menstrual blood a key player in diagnostic testing. With their unique approach and commitment to empowering women, they are poised to make a lasting impact in healthcare. For more information, visit their website at [Qvin](https://qvin.com/).
